Welcome to VivaVeggie

Charlotte's premier farm-to-table vegetarian restaurant

Our Story

From humble beginnings to Charlotte's favorite vegetarian destination

Rooted in Charlotte

VivaVeggie began in 2015 when three friends with a passion for plant-based cooking decided to transform Charlotte's dining scene.

Starting as a small weekend farmer's market stall, we quickly grew a devoted following for our creative vegetarian dishes made with locally-sourced ingredients.

Two years later, we opened our first brick-and-mortar location in the heart of Charlotte. Today, we're proud to offer a full dining experience that celebrates the bounty of local farms while proving that vegetarian cuisine can be both nutritious and delicious.

Eat plants, love life

Our Values

Sustainability

We're committed to sustainable practices that respect our planet and its resources.

Local Sourcing

We partner with local farms to ensure the freshest ingredients while supporting our community.

Compassion

We believe in kind food that's good for people, animals, and our planet.

Culinary Creativity

We reimagine vegetarian cuisine with bold flavors and innovative techniques.

Our Farm to Table Process

Our Farm-to-Table Journey

Discover how we bring the freshest sustainable ingredients from local farms to your plate

1

Local Harvesting

Our journey begins with our network of local farmers who share our commitment to sustainable agriculture. All produce is harvested at peak ripeness using organic farming methods.

2

Sustainable Transport

We minimize our carbon footprint by sourcing from farms within a 50-mile radius and using fuel-efficient vehicles for transport. Our produce travels the shortest distance possible to maintain freshness.

3

Kitchen Preparation

Our chefs inspect each delivery and prepare ingredients using techniques that maximize flavor while preserving nutrients. We practice a zero-waste philosophy in our kitchen.

4

Plate to Palate

The final step is where culinary artistry meets sustainability. Our dishes are plated with care to highlight the natural beauty of our ingredients, served on eco-friendly tableware.

Our Environmental Impact

15,000

Meet Our Team

Meet Our Team

The passionate people behind our farm-to-table mission

Our Chefs

Chef Maria Rodriguez

Executive Chef

With over 15 years of experience in vegetarian cuisine, Maria brings creative vision and technical expertise to every dish. Trained at the Culinary Institute of America, she specializes in transforming traditional dishes into plant-based masterpieces.

"The beauty of plants speaks for itself. My job is just to listen."

Chef James Kim

Pastry Chef

James revolutionizes plant-based desserts with innovative techniques and unexpected flavor combinations. His creations prove that vegan desserts can be just as decadent and satisfying as traditional ones.

"Nature offers the perfect sweetness. We don't need to look further."

Chef Amelia Johnson

Sous Chef

Amelia brings global inspiration to our menu, drawing from her travels across Asia, Europe, and South America. She has a talent for creating bold, complex flavors using simple, sustainable ingredients.

"Cooking with plants connects us to the earth and to each other."

Chef David Ortiz

Farm Liaison & Menu Developer

David works directly with our farm partners to develop seasonal menus that highlight the best of what's growing. His background in both farming and culinary arts makes him the perfect bridge between field and plate.

"The best flavors come from vegetables harvested that same morning."

Our Farmers

Robert Wilson

Green Valley Farm (15 miles)

Robert's family has been farming the same land for four generations. His 20-acre farm specializes in heirloom tomatoes, peppers, and root vegetables grown using regenerative agriculture techniques.

Supplies our seasonal vegetables

Sarah & Michael Chen

Sunrise Orchards (28 miles)

This husband-and-wife team left corporate careers to start their organic orchard. They grow over 15 varieties of apples, pears, and stone fruits using sustainable practices that promote biodiversity.

Supplies our fruits for desserts

Elena Diaz

Wildflower Fields (8 miles)

Elena's urban farm specializes in microgreens, herbs, and edible flowers. Her innovative vertical farming techniques allow her to grow year-round while minimizing water usage and maximizing space.

Supplies our herbs and microgreens

What Our Guests Say

What Our Guests Say

Hear from people who've experienced our farm-to-table difference

I've been a vegetarian for 10 years, and VivaVeggie offers the most creative and flavorful plant-based dishes I've ever tasted. The Buddha Bowl is a must-try, and I love knowing exactly which local farm my food comes from.

Sarah K.

Charlotte, NC

Our Origin Story

Discover how VivaVeggie grew from a simple idea to Charlotte's premier sustainable dining experience, committed to local farming and ethical food practices

2024

Planting New Seeds

Today, we're expanding our impact through our newly launched seed-saving program, farmer mentorship initiative, and cooking academy, all aimed at spreading sustainable food practices throughout our community.

Key Milestones:

  • Launched seed library with 50+ heritage varieties
  • Began farmer mentorship program
  • Opened VivaVeggie Cooking Academy

Our Guiding Values

Sustainability Above All

Every decision we makefrom sourcing to servingis guided by its environmental impact. We believe delicious food shouldn't cost the Earth.

Community Connection

We believe food is a powerful connector. Our restaurant serves as a hub for building relationships between eaters, growers, and the land.

Radical Transparency

We believe you have the right to know exactly where your food comes from, how it was grown, and its journey to your plate.

VivaVeggie

Charlotte's premier farm-to-table vegetarian restaurant bringing sustainable dining to your community.
